verses.kjv: Oh that my head were waters, and mine eyes a fountain of tears, that I might weep day and night for the slain of the daughter of my people!
verses.ct: If only my head were a spring of water and my eyes an endless source of tears, so I could cry day and night for the people of my nation who have been killed!

verses.kjv: Oh that I had in the wilderness a lodging place of wayfaring men; that I might leave my people, and go from them! for they be all adulterers, an assembly of treacherous men.
verses.ct: If only I had a traveler's shelter out in the desert, so I could leave my people and get away from them! They are all unfaithful — a crowd of traitors.

verses.kjv: And they bend their tongues like their bow for lies: but they are not valiant for the truth upon the earth; for they proceed from evil to evil, and they know not me, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: They use their tongues like bows, shooting lies like arrows. They have no courage for the truth in this land. They go from one evil to the next, and they don't acknowledge me," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Take ye heed every one of his neighbour, and trust ye not in any brother: for every brother will utterly supplant, and every neighbour will walk with slanders.
verses.ct: "Watch out for your neighbors, and don't trust even your own brother. Every brother is a deceiver, and every neighbor goes around spreading slander.

verses.kjv: And they will deceive every one his neighbour, and will not speak the truth: they have taught their tongue to speak lies, and weary themselves to commit iniquity.
verses.ct: Everyone lies to their neighbor, and no one speaks the truth. They have trained their tongues to tell lies, and they exhaust themselves doing wrong.

verses.kjv: Thine habitation is in the midst of deceit; through deceit they refuse to know me, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: You live surrounded by deception. Because of their dishonesty, they refuse to acknowledge me," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD of hosts, Behold, I will melt them, and try them; for how shall I do for the daughter of my people?
verses.ct: So the LORD of Armies says this: "Pay attention — I am going to refine them and test them. What else can I do because of my people?

verses.kjv: Their tongue is as an arrow shot out; it speaketh deceit: one speaketh peaceably to his neighbour with his mouth, but in heart he layeth his wait.
verses.ct: Their tongue is a deadly arrow; it speaks nothing but lies. A person talks peacefully to a neighbor, but secretly plots against them.

verses.kjv: Shall I not visit them for these things? saith the LORD: shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
verses.ct: Should I not hold them accountable for these things?" says the LORD. "Should I not bring justice against a nation like this?"

verses.kjv: For the mountains will I take up a weeping and wailing, and for the habitations of the wilderness a lamentation, because they are burned up, so that none can pass through them; neither can men hear the voice of the cattle; both the fowl of the heavens and the beast are fled; they are gone.
verses.ct: I will weep and wail over the mountains, and mourn over the desert pastures, because they are scorched so that no one travels through them. No lowing of cattle can be heard there. The birds of the heavens and the animals have all fled and are gone.

verses.kjv: And I will make Jerusalem heaps, and a den of dragons; and I will make the cities of Judah desolate, without an inhabitant.
verses.ct: "I will turn Jerusalem into a pile of rubble, a place where jackals live. I will make the towns of Judah completely desolate, with no one living in them."

verses.kjv: Who is the wise man, that may understand this? and who is he to whom the mouth of the LORD hath spoken, that he may declare it, for what the land perisheth and is burned up like a wilderness, that none passeth through?
verses.ct: Who is wise enough to understand this? Who has received a message from the LORD and can explain it? Why has the land been destroyed, scorched like a desert that no one crosses?

verses.kjv: And the LORD saith, Because they have forsaken my law which I set before them, and have not obeyed my voice, neither walked therein;
verses.ct: The LORD answered: "It is because they abandoned my instructions that I gave them. They did not obey me or follow my ways.

verses.kjv: But have walked after the imagination of their own heart, and after Baalim, which their fathers taught them:
verses.ct: Instead, they followed the stubbornness of their own hearts and chased after the Baals, just as their ancestors taught them to do."

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will feed them, even this people, with wormwood, and give them water of gall to drink.
verses.ct: So the LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says this: "Pay attention — I will feed these people bitter poison and give them poisoned water to drink.

verses.kjv: I will scatter them also among the heathen, whom neither they nor their fathers have known: and I will send a sword after them, till I have consumed them.
verses.ct: I will scatter them among nations that neither they nor their ancestors have ever known. I will send the sword to pursue them until I have completely destroyed them."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts, Consider ye, and call for the mourning women, that they may come; and send for cunning women, that they may come:
verses.ct: The LORD of Armies says this: "Think about what is coming and summon the professional mourning women. Send for the most skilled among them.

verses.kjv: And let them make haste, and take up a wailing for us, that our eyes may run down with tears, and our eyelids gush out with waters.
verses.ct: Have them come quickly and sing a funeral song over us, so that tears stream from our eyes and water pours from our eyelids."

verses.kjv: For a voice of wailing is heard out of Zion, How are we spoiled! we are greatly confounded, because we have forsaken the land, because our dwellings have cast us out.
verses.ct: The sound of mourning is heard from Zion: "We are ruined! We are completely humiliated! We have had to leave our land because our homes have been torn down around us."

verses.kjv: Yet hear the word of the LORD, O ye women, and let your ear receive the word of his mouth, and teach your daughters wailing, and every one her neighbour lamentation.
verses.ct: Now listen to the word of the LORD, you women. Let your ears take in what he says. Teach your daughters how to mourn, and teach each other songs of grief.

verses.kjv: For death is come up into our windows, and is entered into our palaces, to cut off the children from without, and the young men from the streets.
verses.ct: Death has climbed through our windows and entered our fortresses. It has taken the children from the streets and the young men from the public squares.

verses.kjv: Speak, Thus saith the LORD, Even the carcases of men shall fall as dung upon the open field, and as the handful after the harvestman, and none shall gather them.
verses.ct: Declare this — the LORD says: "Dead bodies will fall like manure on the open ground, like cut grain left behind the harvester, with no one to gather them."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom, neither let the mighty man glory in his might, let not the rich man glory in his riches:
verses.ct: The LORD says this: "The wise person should not boast about their wisdom. The strong person should not boast about their strength. The wealthy person should not boast about their riches.

verses.kjv: But let him that glorieth glory in this, that he understandeth and knoweth me, that I am the LORD which exercise lovingkindness, judgment, and righteousness, in the earth: for in these things I delight, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: Instead, anyone who wants to boast should boast about this: that they understand and know me — that I am the LORD, who acts with faithful love, justice, and righteousness on the earth. These are the things that bring me delight," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will punish all them which are circumcised with the uncircumcised;
verses.ct: "Look, the time is coming," says the LORD, "when I will punish everyone who is circumcised only in body:

verses.kjv: Egypt, and Judah, and Edom, and the children of Ammon, and Moab, and all that are in the utmost corners, that dwell in the wilderness: for all these nations are uncircumcised, and all the house of Israel are uncircumcised in the heart.
verses.ct: Egypt, Judah, Edom, the people of Ammon, Moab, and all the desert dwellers who shave the edges of their hair. All these nations are uncircumcised in body, and the entire house of Israel is uncircumcised in heart."
